Unaccounted cash worth ₹1 crore has also been seized.

349.title: Whole country is talking about Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann & his works: Kejriwal
349.article_body: AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal addressed Punjab AAP MLAs on Sunday and said that the whole country is talking about CM Bhagwant Mann and his works. "Compensation for crops damaged in October has been released and farmers will get cheques in the coming days. You have done good work within three days of forming the government," Kejriwal added.

350.title: 'People know where he goes for walk', K'taka HC Chief Justice gets death threat
350.article_body: An advocate has filed a case over a video of a man threatening to kill Karnataka High Court Chief Justice Ritu Raj Awasthi over hijab ban verdict. He said the man referred to the alleged murder of a Jharkhand judge, who was killed on morning walk. The complainant added the man said people know where Chief Justice goes for walk.

351.title: 877 newborns died as women refused hospital delivery during COVID: Meghalaya govt
351.article_body: As many as 877 newborn babies and 61 mothers died as pregnant women refused to get themselves admitted to hospitals for institutional delivery during the COVID-19 pandemic due to fears of contracting the disease, the Meghalaya government told the NHRC. The NHRC had registered a case over the high number of maternal and newborn deaths in the state during pandemic.

352.title: Sharad Yadav merges his LJD party with Lalu's RJD after parting ways 25 yrs ago
352.article_body: Former Union Minister Sharad Yadav on Sunday merged his Loktantrik Janata Dal (LJD) party with Lalu Prasad Yadav-led Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) in Delhi. The two leaders had parted ways 25 years ago. "Merger of our party with RJD is first step towards Opposition unity. It's imperative that whole Opposition gets united across India to defeat BJP," Sharad said.

353.title: Success is built on OTT today, I'd love to explore OTT space: Govinda
353.article_body: Actor Govinda said in an interview that he would love to explore the digital medium. "Times have definitely changed since we started out, and things have evolved to a point where success is built on OTT platforms today," he added. "OTT is a platform for all kinds of artists, and I would...love to explore...OTT space as an actor," said Govinda.

354.title: Ukraine Prez suspends 11 political parties with links to Russia
354.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a video address on Sunday said that activities of 11 political parties with links to Russia have been suspended for the period of martial law amid the conflict between the two countries. The suspended parties included Viktor Medvedchuk-led Opposition Platform for Life. Medvedchuk claims that Russian President Vladimir Putin is his daughter's godfather.

355.title: Kanye barred from performing at Grammys over 'concerning online behaviour'
355.article_body: Rapper Kanye West has been barred from performing at the Grammy Awards 2022 due to his "concerning online behaviour", said his representative. This comes after West's Instagram account was suspended for 24 hours this week for posting racial comments against 'The Daily Show' host Trevor Noah. Earlier, Noah had criticised West for his posts about his ex-wife, Kim Kardashian.

356.title: US is offering rewards of up to $5 million for info on Russian oligarchs' assets
356.article_body: The US government is offering rewards of up to $5 million for anyone who can provide information leading to the seizure of assets belonging to Russian oligarchs. Under the program, assets can include yachts, jets, and properties situated in the US. The government has also provided names of 28 Russians, for which they are interested in receiving information.

357.title: 64-yr-old man dies after branches of banyan tree fall on him in Mumbai
357.article_body: A 64-year-old man died after the branches of a banyan tree fell on him in Mumbai's Matunga Road. "The injured person was...taken to PD Hinduja Hospital, where doctors declared him dead," an official from the control room of BMC's disaster management cell said. The branches also damaged some shops near the restaurant, as per reports.

358.title: Brad Pitt's 'Bullet Train' release postponed, film to release on July 29
358.article_body: The release of Brad Pitt's 'Bullet Train' has been postponed. The film, which was slated to release on July 15, will now hit the screens on July 29, taking the recently-vacated date of Dwayne Johnson's DC film 'Black Adam'. Also starring Sandra Bullock and Aaron Taylor-Johnson, 'Bullet Train' is an action-thriller film directed by David Leitch.

359.title: I still feel it is not in the spirit of the game: Brian Lara on 'mankading' rule change
359.article_body: After MCC announced 'mankading' will be considered a regular run-out and won't be included in 'unfair play' section of rule book, ex-West Indies captain Brian Lara said, "I still feel it is not in the spirit of the game." Earlier, Ravichandran Ashwin had urged bowlers to not have "second thoughts" on running non-strikers out.

360.title: DC share video of their team room in Mumbai
360.article_body: Delhi Capitals took to Instagram to share video of their team room in Mumbai ahead of IPL 2022. The video shows their recreation room wherein one can see table tennis and pool tables, and video games among other things. The video also features a terrace zone. Delhi Capitals will face Mumbai Indians in their IPL 2022 opener on March 27.

361.title: Woman dies after son attacks her with weapon over property dispute in Delhi
361.article_body: A 53-year-old man, Bhagwan Das, was arrested for allegedly attacking his 76-year-old mother with a weapon in Delhi, leading to her death one day later. Police found that the woman's children began hitting each other over property dispute and Das later attacked her. Police said that the woman was unfit to give statement before passing away.

362.title: I'm from Hindi Medium; never faced roadblocks because of my language: Pankaj
362.article_body: When asked if language ever created any obstacle for him in Bollywood, actor Pankaj Tripathi said he's from Hindi medium background and it has been an advantage for him. "I don't think I ever had to face any...roadblocks because of my language," he said. "If you know from where you come from, you're ready to face any problems," he added.

363.title: Ukraine to get US’ Javelin and Stinger missiles within days, says official
363.article_body: Ukraine's National Security official Oleksiy Danilov has said that the country will receive US weapons including Javelin and Stinger missiles to help them fight against the Russian forces. "The (weapons) will be on the territory of our country in the nearest future. We are talking about days," said Danilov. Ukraine has so far received weapon shipments from several countries.

364.title: One of Europe's biggest steel plants in Ukraine damaged by Russia, video surfaces
364.article_body: Azovstal, one of Europe's biggest steel plants, was damaged as Russian forces attacked the Ukrainian port city of Mariupol, officials said. Sharing a video on Twitter, Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko wrote, "The economic losses for #Ukraine are huge. The environment is devastated." "We will return to the city, rebuild the enterprise and revive it," Azovstal Director General Enver Tskitishvili said.

365.title: Carpenter from UP shot at, 3 CRPF personnel injured in grenade attacks in J&K
365.article_body: A carpenter from Uttar Pradesh was shot at and three Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel were injured in two separate grenade attacks by suspected militants in Jammu and Kashmir. The carpenter, who was critically injured, was immediately shifted to SMHS Hospital in Srinagar, where he is undergoing treatment. Police have registered cases in connection with the terror crimes.

366.title: 'The Kashmir Files' won't provide political advantage to anyone: Sanjay Raut
366.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said it is not right to do politics on a sensitive issue like Kashmir. "'The Kashmir Files' is just a film, I don't think it will provide any political advantage to anyone in the coming elections," Raut added ahead of the BMC elections. "By the time elections come, the film will be gone," Raut stated.

367.title: All not well in BJP, says Digambar Kamat on delay in govt formation in Goa
367.article_body: Goa Leader of Opposition Digambar Kamat said that even after a week’s time since the Assembly poll results were declared in Goa, there has been a delay in swearing-in the new government which indicates that "all is not well in BJP". "The people of Goa are deprived of a government to govern the state," Kamat added.

368.title: I can't see the pitch being much different: Cummins on same XI for 3rd Pak Test
368.article_body: Australia have named an unchanged playing XI for the series-deciding third Test against Pakistan, starting on Monday. Talking about it, Australia captain Pat Cummins said, "We were happy with how all 11 players [played in] last Test...[pitch] seems hard, but I can't see it being too much different from the [previous] ones." The first two Tests ended in a draw.

369.title: Every state can think on it: Pralhad on Bhagavad Gita in schools
369.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Saturday reacted to the Gujarat government's decision to introduce the Bhagavad Gita in the school syllabus, saying that every state can think about it.  "Bhagavad Gita teaches us morality and ethics. It shows us the responsibility towards wellbeing of society," he added. He further said that scripture has many moral stories that can inspire students.

370.title: BJP luring 10 Gujarat Congress MLAs, claims Rajasthan CM's adviser
370.article_body: Sanyam Lodha, an adviser to Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, has claimed that BJP is allegedly trying to lure 10 Gujarat Congress MLAs ahead of the state elections later this year. "Number may eventually be more than 10... I had warned (Congress' Gujarat in charge) Raghu Sharma a month ago but there was no response, so I tweeted," Lodha said.

371.title: Sanctions against Russia over Ukraine outrageous: Chinese minister
371.article_body: Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Le Yucheng on Saturday said the sanctions against Russia over the Ukraine situation "are getting more and more outrageous". He said that the Russian citizens were being deprived of overseas assets for no reason. "The consequences of forcing a major power, especially a nuclear power, into a corner are even more unimaginable," Yucheng added.

372.title: Target is 2024 LS polls, needs more hard work: Mulayam to SP cadre
372.article_body: SP patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav has addressed the party workers by saying that the next "target is 2024" general elections and will require "more hard work and strengthening of the party". Speaking at a Holi gathering in Saifai, Yadav praised the workers for their effort which helped SP in getting its highest vote share ever in the UP Assembly elections.

373.title: Karnataka govt provides 'Y' category security to HC judges who gave hijab verdict
373.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday said that 'Y' category security will be provided to three judges of Karnataka High Court, including Chief Justice Ritu Raj Awasthi, who recently upheld the ban on hijab in educational institutions. This comes after a video of a person threatening to kill Justice Awasthi surfaced online. Three persons have been booked in this connection.

374.title: Around 100 injured as makeshift gallery collapses at football ground in Kerala
374.article_body: Around 100 people are said to be injured after a makeshift gallery collapsed at a football ground in Kerala. The gallery was made of bamboo and areca nut tree slats and collapsed after it couldn't withstand pressure with hundreds of people sitting on it to watch a football match. Several of the injured had broken legs and arms. reports said.

375.title: Rahul gave me bowling, he's my favourite captain: Shreyas Iyer
375.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer has praised KL Rahul's captaincy, stating that the 29-year-old has a "very calm demeanour" and his on-field decision making is very "instinctive". Iyer added, "I really enjoyed playing under him. Also, he gave me three overs of bowling [during South Africa ODIs], which none of the captains previously had done. So yeah, he's my favourite captain."

376.title: Baseless allegations made due to Raj polls next yr: Vaibhav Gehlot
376.article_body: President of the Rajasthan Cricket Association Vaibhav Gehlot has dismissed the allegations levelled at him of duping a Nashik resident. "Rajasthan Assembly polls (are) scheduled to be held next year. So, these kinds of baseless allegations will be levelled at me," said Gehlot. The FIR was lodged against 16 people, including Gehlot, at the Gangapur Police Station in Nashik.

377.title: US man wrongfully jailed for 23 years seeks $93 million in lawsuit
377.article_body: A 45-year-old man from US' Kansas has filed a lawsuit seeking $93 million (over ₹706 crore) in damages after he was wrongfully convicted for double murder. Lamonte McIntyre and his mother claimed that a detective coerced her into sex and then framed him for murder after she rejected the detective's sexual advances later. McIntyre had served 23 years in jail.

378.title: Multiple explosions at Pakistan military base spark massive fire, video surfaces
378.article_body: A massive explosion occurred in the northern Pakistani city of Sialkot on Sunday, ANI reported. Rishi Suri, editor of The Daily Milap, said that multiple explosions took place at the Sialkot military base in northern Pakistan. He said in a tweet, "Initial indications are this is an ammunition storage area. A large fire is burning. Cause as yet unverified."

379.title: Unfortunate that Congress didn't call it a genocide: Anupam on 'The Kashmir...'
379.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher, who starred in 'The Kashmir Files', reacted to the Congress' remark wherein they said that the Kashmiri Hindus cannot be classified as "internally displaced persons". He said, "It is unfortunate that the ruling government of that time did not think of protecting or of not calling it a genocide." "It is a genocide...It's not fiction," he added.

380.title: Bhagavad Gita in textbooks will improve kids' intelligence level: Bommai
380.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that if Bhagavad Gita is incorporated in textbooks, it will improve the intelligence level among children. "What is wrong with it? The education department is also making preparations to introduce it in our state. Let them give their report first. We will then decide in this regard," he added.

381.title: SC issues notice on daughters’ plea to trace 89-year-old mother
381.article_body: The Supreme Court issued notice on a petition filed by two daughters seeking their mother’s whereabouts, a resident of Bihar’s Muzaffarpur. The 89-year-old woman was brought to Delhi’s Ganga Ram hospital for treatment in February, 2022 but remained untraced after February 26 when she was moved to an undisclosed location by her son.

382.title: Elizabeth Hurley shares old pics with Warne from their engagement celebration in SL
382.article_body: Late Australian cricketer Shane Warne's ex-fiancée Elizabeth Hurley took to Instagram to share old pictures with Warne from their engagement celebration in Sri Lanka. "My heart aches...I can't be in Australia for Shane's [private] funeral," she wrote. She added, "It seems too cruel that all...people who loved him will never have another Lion hug, but our memories will live forever."

383.title: Vir Das praises Ukrainian comedians for organising show in bomb shelter
383.article_body: Comedian-actor Vir Das reacted to a report saying that comedians in Ukraine's Sumy held a stand-up show in a bomb shelter amid the Russian invasion. The Kyiv Independent, a Ukraine media outlet, shared that three comedians performed for about 100 people in one of the bomb shelters in Sumy. Vir shared the report and dropped a few clapping hands emojis.

384.title: H'wood action choreographer Yannick Ben joins Samantha's 'Yashoda'
384.article_body: Hollywood action choreographer Yannick Ben has been roped in for Samantha Ruth Prabhu's action-thriller 'Yashoda'. Yannick has previously worked in films like 'Transporter 3', 'Inception' and 'Dunkirk'. He has also worked in Indian projects, including 'The Family Man', Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Raees' and Salman Khan's 'Tiger Zinda Hai'. 'Yashoda' will release in multiple languages.

385.title: Eng beat NZ by 1 wicket to register their 2nd win in Women's WC 2022
385.article_body: England defeated New Zealand by one wicket to register their second win in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup 2022. Chasing New Zealand's 203-run total England's Natalie Sciver scored 61 off 108 balls as her side managed to save a wicket and won the match in 47.2 overs. This is New Zealand's fourth defeat in six games in the tournament.

386.title: Woman dies as police constable allegedly shoots her in Punjab, probe on
386.article_body: A woman died after a police constable allegedly shot her in Punjab's Haibowal area. Police rushed to spot and found a dead woman with a bullet injury. "Investigations are going on...prima facie is yet to be confirmed....the accused, who shot the woman, was constable...He has been hospitalised due to a bullet wound by the neighbours," Police said.

387.title: Depression over southeast Bay of Bengal, Andaman Sea to intensify in 24 hrs
387.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) said that Saturday's low-pressure system intensified into a depression over the southeast Bay of Bengal and the adjoining south Andaman Sea on Sunday. The depression will further intensify into a deep depression in the next 24 hours, the IMD added. The IMD had earlier predicted Cyclone Asani over Bay of Bengal on March 21.

388.title: Russian cosmonauts deny flight suits are inspired by Ukrainian flag
388.article_body: Russian cosmonaut Oleg Artemyev denied their flight suits are inspired by Ukrainian flag. He said, "There is no need to look for any hidden symbols." He added that the three cosmonauts who arrived at International Space Station wearing yellow suits with blue accents were graduates of Bauman Moscow State Technical University and had picked the colours of their alma mater.

389.title: China on right side of history: Chinese Minister on Ukraine crisis
389.article_body: Chinese Foreign Affairs Minister Wang Yi told reporters on Saturday that "time will prove" that the country's claims are on the "right side of history" over the Russia-Ukraine conflict. He added that the country stands for maintaining peace and its position is "in line with the wishes of most countries". Earlier, China had said that Russia has "legitimate security concerns".

390.title: Remo D'Souza pays off the loan for a contestant on sets of DID L'il Masters 5
390.article_body: Choreographer Remo D'Souza paid off the loan of an eight-year-old contestant named Himanshu on the DID Li'l Masters 5. Himanshu's mother revealed she is being harassed because she's a female rickshaw puller, and has also landed in a debt to buy the rickshaw. Hearing this, Remo said, "Please let me know the amount that's pending, I will pay it off."

391.title: Kyiv mocks Russia after shooting down their jet, shares meme
391.article_body: The official Twitter account of the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv mocked Russia after shooting down Russia's Su-34. It wrote, "Another Russian Su-34 was shot down near Kyiv. It makes it, what, 94th?" It added, "Wondering what will happen first... the 100th plane or 300 rubles for $1? Tell us what you think!" The Russia-Ukraine war entered its 25th day today.

392.title: 2 dead, 23 rescued as wall of old building undergoing renovation collapses in Guj
392.article_body: Two persons died and 23 others were rescued after the wall of an old commercial building, where renovation work was underway, collapsed in Gujarat's Surat. The wall of the building's second floor collapsed when drilling activity was in progress and injured the two youths, who were standing on the ground. They were declared dead on arrival at a hospital.

393.title: I feel no. 3 is my position, but I'm ready to explore: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer
393.article_body: KKR's newly-appointed captain Shreyas Iyer has said he's ready to bat at any position in the upcoming IPL season. "On a given day, I can be a power-hitter and there can be some other player who can play anchor role...I feel number three is my position [but]...wherever team wants me to bat at...I'm ready to explore," he added.

394.title: 4 pose as ACB officers, extort ₹10 lakh from BDA officers in B'luru
394.article_body: Four men have been arrested for allegedly posing as Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) officers and extorting ₹10 lakh from Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) engineers. The accused reportedly extorted the money under the pretext of removing the engineers' names from ACB's case files. The incident came to light after one of the engineers filed a complaint in the matter.

395.title: 2 dead, 14 injured as dumper rams into 2 vehicles in Haryana's Nuh
395.article_body: Two persons, including a minor, died and 14 persons were injured after a dumper carrying stones allegedly rammed into a tractor thresher and a bus in Haryana's Nuh on Saturday. Locals and relatives of the victims alleged police officials were chasing the dumper to check for illegal mining and they fired a gunshot flattening the dumper's tyre, leading to collision.

396.title: Russia has failed to gain control of air: UK on Ukraine resistance
396.article_body: The UK Ministry of Defence has said the Ukrainian Air Force is continuing to effectively defend Ukrainian airspace. It added, "Russia has failed to gain control of the air and is largely relying on stand-off weapons launched from the relative safety of Russian airspace." It also said that gaining control of the air was one of Russia's principal objectives.

397.title: 20 including kids injured, 1 killed in shooting at car show in US
397.article_body: One person was killed and 20 others, including children, were injured in a shooting outside a car show in Dumas in US' Arkansas on Saturday, police said. One person has been taken into custody, but there may've been multiple shooters, the town's Police Chief Keith Finch said. "For something like this to happen, it's a tragedy," the event's organiser said.

398.title: 24-year-old man attacks worshippers in Canada mosque with bear spray
398.article_body: A 24-year-old man entered a mosque in Canada's Toronto and attacked people with bear spray on Saturday, said police. The worshippers at Dar Al-Tawheed Islamic Centre tackled the man, identified as Mohammad Moiz Oma, who was reportedly brandishing a hatchet. "They tackled him to the ground and apprehended him until the police showed up," said a Muslim body official.

399.title: Pope meets refugee Ukrainian children undergoing treatment in Rome
399.article_body: Pope Francis on Saturday met Ukrainian children who escaped war and are currently undergoing treatment at a paediatric hospital in Rome. He was seen talking to a girl with a bandaged head in a picture. As many as 19 children are receiving treatment for cancer, neurological conditions or war injuries caused by explosions, said the Vatican.

400.title: Was invited alone on 1st date, took all friends: Isha Koppikar on husband
400.article_body: Actress Isha Koppikar said that her husband Timmy Narang had invited her to his house for their first date. "He had invited only me alone...but I took all my friends along! I recall telling him, 'If you want me to come and meet you, they will accompany me'. There were 15 of us...we landed up at his place," Isha added.

401.title: Kashmiri Pandits will get relief when they return home in valley: Bukhari
401.article_body: Apni Party chief Altaf Bukhari said that Kashmiri Pandits will only get relief when they return to their homes in valley. While talking about 'The Kashmir Files', he said, "If rehabilitation takes place by making movie...I would have liked 50 more movies...I'm not saying do not make movies...what when such movies are made to help someone get votes?" he added.

402.title: Virat told me on the bus 'You might've to captain': Rahul recalls SA tour
402.article_body: Recalling the South Africa tour, where he captained India in the Johannesburg Test, KL Rahul said, "Like everyone else, [captaincy] came to me as a huge surprise." Rahul added, "The morning of the game, Virat (Kohli) came to me...said, 'My back is not feeling great, you might've to captain'...it's an honour not many people get....I was very happy."

403.title: 5 teenagers drown while swimming in river after playing Holi in Gujarat
403.article_body: Five teenagers drowned when they went for a swim in a local river after playing Holi in Gujarat's Devbhumi Dwarka district. Police said after home guard jawans posted there prevented the boys from jumping in the river, they entered the river from the opposite bank. "Apparently, they were not aware that the water was deep that side," an inspector said.
